```{r}
library(tidyverse)
head(mtcars)
```

```{r}
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) + geom_point() +geom_smooth(method=lm, se=FALSE)
p
  
```
```{r}

data(matcars)
fit = lm(mpg ~ wt, data=mtcars)
summary(fit)


```




```{r}
pval <- summary(fit)$coefficients[2,4]
tvalue <- summary(fit)$coefficients[2,3]
beta <- summary(fit)$coefficients[2,1]
rsq <- summary(fit)$r.squared
fstats <-summary(fit)$fstatistic
df2 <-summary(fit)$df[2]
str(fstats)
```


Weight significantly predicted fuel efficienty (MPG), b = `r round(beta,2)`, t(`r df2`) = `r round(tvalue,2)`, p = `r round(pval,2)`. Weight also explained a significant proportion of variance in fuel efficienty, R2 = `r round(rsq, 2)`, F( `r fstats[2]`, `r fstats[3]` ) = `r round(fstats[1],2)`, p = `r round(pval,2)`.
